ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a secure, self-hosted, and easy-to-deploy remote management platform for KVM devices, suitable for individuals and small businesses.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Device Management â€¢ Script Deployment â€¢ Remote SSH â€¢ Remote Control â€¢ Batch Operations
ðŸ“– Summary: GLKVM Cloud is a self-hosted, lightweight KVM remote management platform designed for individuals and small businesses. It offers secure remote access, device management, and batch operations, built upon the rttys project for rapid deployment and full data control.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ TempFastMail | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a temporary, self-hosted email inbox for receiving messages without long-term storage, ideal for sign-ups or testing purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-hosted temporary email inbox â€¢ Receives and displays messages â€¢ Automatic email deletion after 48 hours â€¢ Admin interface for manual deletion â€¢ Docker Compose setup
ðŸ“– Summary: TempFastMail is a self-hosted, disposable email inbox solution built with PHP and React. It allows users to quickly set up a temporary email address to receive and view messages, with automatic deletion after 48 hours for privacy.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ firefly-iii | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide individuals with a comprehensive, self-hosted tool for managing personal finances, enabling better budgeting, expense tracking, and financial insight.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-hosted and isolated, no external server contact unless explicitly configured. â€¢ REST JSON API for extensive programmatic control. â€¢ Support for recurring transactions.
ðŸ“– Summary: Firefly III is a self-hosted personal finance manager designed to help users track income and expenses, manage budgets, and gain insight into their financial habits. It provides tools for budgeting, categorization, tagging, and offers various financial reports, all while ensuring user data privacy and control.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ pageindex-mcp | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling LLM-based applications to perform advanced information retrieval and reasoning over documents without relying on traditional vector databases, by exposing a structured, tree-based index through the MCP protocol.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Vectorless, reasoning-based RAG â€¢ Hierarchical tree structures for documents
ðŸ“– Summary: PageIndex MCP is a server that exposes PageIndex, a vectorless, reasoning-based RAG system, directly to LLMs and agents. It allows platforms like Claude and Cursor to interact with document structure via tree indexing, eliminating the need for vector databases and enabling human-like information retrieval from long documents.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ NetScan-Pro | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Network reconnaissance and security assessment for administrators and professionals.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Network Discovery (Live host detection, device enumeration, gateway/subnet mapping) â€¢ Port Scanning (Quick, Standard, Full) â€¢ Service Detection (Web, Database, Version fingerprinting) â€¢ Security Assessment (Vulnerability scanning, CVE identification)
ðŸ“– Summary: NetScan Pro is an interactive Bash-based network scanning tool that offers live host discovery, port scanning, traceroute, and ping tests. It is designed for network administrators and security professionals, providing a user-friendly interface with colorful outputs and visual elements for network reconnaissance and security assessment.
